00056 /**
00057  * A base class for writing single-threaded, evented servers that use non-blocking I/O.
00058  * It uses libev for its event loop. EventedServer handles much of the situps regarding
00059  * client connection management and output buffering and tries to make it easy to
00060  * implement a zero-copy architecture.
00061  *
00062  * <h2>Basic usage</h2>
00063  * Derived classes can override the onClientReadable() method, which is called every time
00064  * a specific client becomes readable. It is passed a Client object which contains information
00065  * about the client, such as its file descriptor. One can use the read() system call in
00066  * that method to receive data from the client. Please note that client file descriptors
00067  * are always set to non-blocking mode so you need to handle this gracefully.
00068  *
00069  * EventedServer provides the write() method for sending data to the client. This method
00070  * will attempt to send the data to the client immediately; if it fails with EAGAIN then
00071  * EventedServer will take care of scheduling the send at a later time when the client
00072  * is ready again to receive data.
00073  *
00074  * To disconnect the client, call disconnect(). The connection might not be actually
00075  * closed until all pending outgoing data have been sent out, but all the gory details
00076  * is taken care of for you.
00077  *
00078  * <h2>Keeping per-client information</h2>
00079  * If you need to keep per-client information then you can override the createClient()
00080  * method and make it return an object that's a subclass of EventedServer::Client. This
00081  * object is passed to onClientReadable(), so in there you can just cast the client object
00082  * to your subclass.
00083  *
00084  * <h2>Client object life times</h2>
00085  * All client objects are destroyed along with the EventedServer. Disconnecting
00086  * a client also causes it to be destroyed after the current event handler has
00087  * run or a short period of time after that.
00088  */
00089 class EventedServer {
00090 protected:

00107                         message << ": " << strerror(errorCode) << " (" << errorCode << ")");
00108         }

00111                 P_ERROR(message << ": " << strerror(errorCode) << " (" << errorCode << ")");

00121         /**
00122          * Called when a client has been disconnected. This may either be triggered
00123          * immediately by disconnect() or triggered after pending data has been sent
00124          * out. This means that if you call disconnect() from onClientReadable() you
00125          * need take care of the possibility that control returns to onClientReadable()
00126          * after this method is done.
00127          *
00128          * Please note that when EventedServer is being destroyed,
00129          * onClientDisconnected() is *not* triggered.
00130          */
00131         virtual void onClientDisconnected(EventedClient *client) { }

00153         static void _onReadable(EventedClient *client) {
00154                 EventedServer *server = (EventedServer *) client->userData;
00155                 client->ref();
00156                 ScopeGuard guard(boost::bind(&EventedClient::unref, client));
00157                 server->onClientReadable((EventedClient *) client);

00161                 EventedServer *server = (EventedServer *) client->userData;
00162                 ScopeGuard guard1(boost::bind(&EventedClient::unref, client));
00163                 
00164                 client->ref();
00165                 ScopeGuard guard2(boost::bind(&EventedClient::unref, client));
00166                 
00167                 server->removeClient(client);
00168                 server->onClientDisconnected((EventedClient *) client);
00169         }

00172                 EventedServer *server = (EventedServer *) client->userData;
00173                 ScopeGuard guard1(boost::bind(&EventedClient::unref, client));
00174                 
00175                 client->ref();
00176                 ScopeGuard guard2(boost::bind(&EventedClient::unref, client));
00177

00179         }
00180         
00181         static void _onSystemError(EventedClient *client, const string &message, int code) {
00182                 EventedServer *server = (EventedServer *) client->userData;
00183                 server->logSystemError(client, message, code);
00184         }

00186         void exceptionThrownWhileInitializingClient(EventedClient *client, ClientSet::iterator it) {
00187                 if (!client->ioAllowed()) {
00188                         // onNewClient() disconnected or detached the
00189                         // client, so client refcount == 1
00190                         client->unref();
00191                 } else {
00192                         // client refcount == 2
00193                         client->unref();
00194                         client->unref();
00195                         clients.erase(it);
00196                 }
00197                 // Now client refcount == 0
00198         }
00199         
00200         void onAcceptable(ev::io &w, int revents) {
00201                 this_thread::disable_syscall_interruption dsi;
00202                 int i = 0;
00203                 bool done = false;
00204                 
00205                 // Accept at most 10 connections on every accept readiness event
00206                 // in order to give other events the chance to be processed.
00207                 while (i < 10 && !done) {
00208                         // Reserve enough space to hold both a Unix domain socket
00209                         // address and an IP socket address.
00210                         union {
00211                                 struct sockaddr_un local;
00212                                 struct sockaddr_in inet;
00213                         } addr;
00214                         socklen_t len = sizeof(addr);
00215                         
00216                         int clientfd = syscalls::accept(fd, (struct sockaddr *) &addr, &len);
00217                         if (clientfd == -1) {
00218                                 if (errno != EAGAIN && errno != EWOULDBLOCK) {
00219                                         int e = errno;
00220                                         logSystemError("Cannot accept new client", e);
00221                                 }
00222                                 done = true;
00223                         } else {
00224                                 FileDescriptor clientfdGuard = clientfd;
00225                                 int optval = 1;
00226                                 
00227                                 setNonBlocking(clientfdGuard);
00228                                 syscalls::setsockopt(clientfd, SOL_SOCKET, SO_KEEPALIVE,
00229                                         &optval, sizeof(optval));
00230                                 
00231                                 EventedClient *client = createClient(clientfdGuard);
00232                                 client->onReadable    = _onReadable;
00233                                 client->onDisconnect  = _onDisconnect;
00234                                 client->onDetach      = _onDetach;
00235                                 client->onSystemError = _onSystemError;
00236                                 client->userData      = this;
00237                                 client->notifyReads(true);
00238                                 
00239                                 pair<ClientSet::iterator, bool> p = clients.insert(client);
00240                                 
00241                                 client->ref();
00242                                 // client refcount == 2
00243                                 {
00244                                         ScopeGuard g(boost::bind(
00245                                                 &EventedServer::exceptionThrownWhileInitializingClient,
00246                                                 this,
00247                                                 client,
00248                                                 p.first));
00249                                         onNewClient(client);
00250                                         g.clear();
00251                                         // If exception occurred: client refcount == 0
00252                                 }
00253                                 
00254                                 /* No exception occured.
00255                                  * If onNewClient() disconnected or detached the client:
00256                                  *     client refcount == 1
00257                                  *     We want the refcount to become 0.
00258                                  * If not:
00259                                  *     client refcount == 2
00260                                  *     We want the refcount to become 1.
00261                                  */
00262                                 client->unref();
00263                         }
00264                         i++;
00265                 }
00266         }

00268 public:
00269         EventedServer(struct ev_loop *_loop, FileDescriptor serverFd)
00270                 : loop(_loop),
00271                   acceptWatcher(_loop)
00272         {
00273                 fd = serverFd;
00274                 setNonBlocking(serverFd);
00275                 acceptWatcher.set<EventedServer, &EventedServer::onAcceptable>(this);
00276                 acceptWatcher.start(fd, ev::READ);
00277         }
